review_text: This certainly doesn't resemble a sanctuary. Birds in small cages appear unhappy and not very healthy.
Pros: The environment is clean and offers a pleasant atmosphere. Various species of birds, lizards, pythons, and brown Philippine deer can be observed. ‚Ä¶

Great place to take the kids. They love the animals (there is a whole zoo, not just crocodiles) and the small playground. It's mostly shaded and the price is reasonable. Costs my wife and kids a out 200 pesos to go for the day. You could see everything in just an hour or two, but it's nice.
Quite entertaining and educational especially for children...

See the animals up close and personal, the name does not do it justice. There were several types of mammals, reptiles, biggest snakes I have ever seen and birds, birds and more birds. Well worth the trip and the 100 pesos. I highly recommend it, no experience like this in the states for sure that I know of.
